questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Cambodia is renowned for its blend of Hindu and Buddhist iconography and was originally constructed in the early 12th century?
questions.context: Once the heart of the Khmer Empire, this site still engages endless numbers of tourists with its intricate carvings and majestic towers symbolizing Mount Meru, the home of the gods.

questions.question: What UNESCO site in China, known for its terracotta warriors, was uncovered in 1974 and represents the armies of the first Emperor of China?
questions.context: Comprising thousands of life-sized figures, this site was fortuitously discovered by local farmers and offers a glimpse into China's ancient history during the Qin dynasty.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Mexico, formerly a major hub of the Mayan civilization, features the famous Pyramid of Kukulcán?
questions.context: Located on the Yucatán Peninsula, this site draws crowds during the spring equinox to witness the 'serpent' descending the pyramid steps.

questions.question: Identify the UNESCO site in Greece, home to the Parthenon, which served as a citadel during ancient times?
questions.context: This iconic site stands atop a rocky hill, symbolizing the complexities and grandeur of Athenian heritage and democracy.

questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Peru is considered an emblem of the Inca Empire and was largely unknown to the outside world until 1911?
questions.context: Perched high in the Andes Mountains, this site is known for its sophisticated dry-stone construction that fuses giant blocks without the use of mortar.
